main event: On December 6, 1961, a visual observation of an ascending object was reported in St. Thomas, Virgin Islands.
interesting points: The object exhibited sudden changes in direction and speed, appearing to accelerate to a midcourse reverse motion., The observer described the object as a bright light, the size of a basketball at one mile away., No sound was reported during the observation., The object departed rapidly, leaving no exhaust trail., The appearance of the object resembled a comet with a gaseous shroud trailing behind.
witness description: An observer who noted the object's rapid ascent and motion.
